premises: If an object is heated, then its temperature increases
If an object is heated, then its shape deforms
The object's temperature does not increase or its shape does not deform
conclusions: Its temperature and shape deformation is false
If an object is heated, then its temperature increases and its shape deforms
incorrect conclusions: If an object is heated, then its temperature increases and its shape does not deform
If its temperature increases and its shape deforms, then an object is heated
If its temperature increases, then an object is heated
Its temperature increases or its shape deforms but not both are true
If an object is not heated, then its temperature does not increase or its shape does not deform

premises: If a particle is accelerated, then it gains energy
If a particle is accelerated, then it changes direction
The particle does not gain energy or it does not change direction
conclusions: Its energy gain and direction change are false
If a particle is accelerated, then it gains energy and changes direction
incorrect conclusions: If a particle is accelerated, then it gains energy and does not change direction
If it gains energy and changes direction, then a particle is accelerated
If it gains energy, then a particle is accelerated
It gains energy or it changes direction but not both are true
If a particle is not accelerated, then it does not gain energy or it does not change direction

premises: If light passes through a medium, then its speed decreases
If light passes through a medium, then it refracts
Light's speed does not decrease or it does not refract
conclusions: Light does not pass through a medium
Its speed decrease and refraction are false
If light passes through a medium, then its speed decreases and it refracts
incorrect conclusions: If light passes through a medium, then its speed decreases and it does not refract
If its speed decreases and it refracts, then light passes through a medium
If its speed decreases, then light passes through a medium
Its speed decreases or it refracts but not both are true
If light does not pass through a medium, then its speed does not decrease or it does not refract
